Comment anchor prefix: Every comment gets an own anchor which contains the uid of the comment. In the default case the anchor will look something like that: #comment1337.
Show comment anchor name: This anchor will appear in front of the comment numbering.
Write comment anchor name: This anchor will appear in front of the comment form.
Successful anchor name: This is the anchor of the flash message which notifies the user that his comment has been submitted successfully.
Custom messages anchor name: This anchor is part of index action and marks the flash message container to show customMessages, like "You can't vote for your own comment."
Show Gravatar image: Enables or disables the usage of gravatar images
Gravatar image size: Size (in pixel) of gravatar images
Gravatar Default image: This option specifies the default image for e-mail addresses without a gravatar
Use entry uid: Enables or disables the usage of entryUid
Entry uid: GET Parameter configuration of entry (e.g. news "GP:tx_news_pi1|news")

Enable replies to comments: Enables or disables the reply link and adds a hidden field to new comment form with uid of parent comment. If this option is activated the next one should be activated, too.
Show replies to comments: Enables or disables the display of already existing replies to comments.
Count replies: If true, the placeholder {commentCount} will also count replies on comments. Otherwise just comments (no replies) will get counted.
Invert comment sorting: Per default oldest comments are displayed first. If this option is true, the order of comments get inverted (newest comments first).
Invert reply sorting: See invertCommentSorting. Affects replies of comments instead of comments itself.
Enable comment votes: Enables or disables the voting controls for comments.
Enable reply votes: Enables or disables the voting controls for replies.
Enable voting: If disabled votes are visible but users may not vote for comments/replies. This is useful if you want to restrict possibility to vote for eg. logged in users but show the votings.
Hide vote buttons: If enabled the voting buttons are not visible. Caution: The voting functionality itself is still enabled.
Ignore voting for own comments: If enabled users are not allowed to vote for their own comments/replies.
Moderate new comments: If this option is enabled, comments are not automatically visible. A back end user has to activate them first.

Send mail on new comments to: One or more e-mail addresses who will be informed every time a new comment has been submitted. Separate multiple recipients using a comma or leave empty to disable e-mail notifications.
Send mail template: Defines the path to the Fluid template which should be used for notification e-mails
Send mail mime type: Defines the MIME-type of the e-mail body. Please note that changes made here also need to be regarded in the appropriate template.
Send mail to author after submit: If this option is enabled, the author receives a mail after each comment he/she has written.
After submit mail template: Defines the path to the Fluid template which should be used for the e-mail to comment author.
Send mail to author after publish: If this option is enabled, the author receives a mail after a comment he/she has written has been published. This option requires activated "moderateNewComments".
After publish mail template: Defines the path to the Fluid template which should be used for the e-mail to comment author.
Seconds between two comments: Defines the number of seconds an user has to wait before they may post another comment (includes all pages)
Link URLs in comments: If activated this option recognises and links domains.
Use bad words list: Enables or disables the usage of bad word list. This option just checks the entered comment message.
Use bad words list on username: If enabled performs bad words check on entered username. This option may be activated seperately from useBadWordsList option.
Use bad words list on mail addresses: Same like option useBadWordsListOnUsername, just for the entered email address.
Path to bad word list: Defines the path a bad word list containing regular expressions (one in each line).
Hidden field - spam protection: If enabled an additional hidden field will be added to the comment form. If this field is filled (for example by a bot) the comment will not be saved.
Hidden field name: Field name of the hidden field (type="input")
Hidden field CSS class: CSS class for hiding the field

Absolute format fallback for relative dates: The dates of comments will be shown as relative dates (for example "2 hours ago"). After a longer period of time, the view helper switches to an absolute date. This setting controlls the output of this absolute date.
